topics.body:
"@Kaz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5561e91263687263c2ba1100#post_5561e91263687263c2ba1100
Think of a bus or something that travels just below the speed of light. A passenger from the back seat goes to a seat in the front. The speed at which the passenger travels from backseat to frontseat is added to the vehicle speed. So if it weren't for the time slow mechanism, the passenger would've traveled faster than the speed of light if you measure his speed relative to the road.

One must remember that everything is realtive

topics.body: On a sidenote, I remember in highschool I made a theory that all particles are gridded where each point is one planck length distance from it's next point. And I even came up with equations and every thing to give the probability of where a particle would wind up if the particle was enclosed in a square area of some length and width like if the particle was enclosed in a space 3 planck lengths long and 3 planck lengths wide then the prob. Of the place where it'd end up next would be L x W = 9 p=1/9 places (including the place where the particle is, subtract one if excluding the particles position).
topics.author: 37e5b9d66361642500af5e00

topics.body:
"@Kaz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5561ec056368721b82461e00#post_5561ec056368721b82461e00
An eye can see in 2d, two eyes see in 3d.

Like taking picture of an object with two cameras side-by-side. View one picture then the other quickly. It produces a 3d effect.

That is why I can't see 3D movies. I'm a bloody cyclops!
